Calling all K-4th grade boys & girls... youre invited to join Cub Scouts!

Parents, youre invited to bring your son or daughter with you to find out more about Cub Scouting at our INFORMATIONAL MEETING ON TUESDAY, SEPTEMBER 15 AT FOREST PRESERVE PARK. That evening, your child can sit in and experience a den meeting (dens are organized by grade level). Due to COVID-19 restrictions, we are asking everyone to wear a mask and for one parent to attend the informational meeting in order to limit the number of those in attendance.

Cub Scouting is fun for the whole family with hands-on learning through skill building activities, community service projects, and outdoor-minded knowledge. A few of our favorite events are camping out in Memorial Stadium, the Pinewood Derby, the community food drive, and much more! Den and Pack meetings are typically held Tuesday evenings for about an hour throughout the school year. Due to COVID-19, we plan to meet at outdoor locations as much as possible.

post_text:
High School Graduation Plans:

Bement High School is planning to present each student with their high school diploma individually. Students may have up to 4 family members present during the individual presentation. This portion will be recorded. Valedictorian/Salutatorian speeches and scholarship presentations will be recorded as well. These components will be made into one video and will be shared virtually. We are also planning a "Parade of Graduates" through town so families may congratulate and support the seniors while practicing social distancing. The individual diploma presentations will be held on Friday, May 22nd beginning at 5:00 PM and the Parade of Graduates will begin at 7:00 PM. We are still working on the details for the parade and other components that will be included in the final video. Thank you all for your support as we make plans to celebrate the Class of 2020!

March 18 at 3:00 PM 路 Bement, IL 路

We are asking rural communities to share how COVID-19 is impacting them and how teachers and teacher-leaders are adapting in the face of nationwide school closures. Read below for a great story from Sheila Greenwood of Bement, Illinois (Bement CUSD 5). You can share yours here: bit.ly/iaartcovid

"Our staff has really risen up to the challenge. They are the calm in the middle of the storm and they are keeping kids as their number one priority. We are providing breakfast, lunch and milks for all of the children who need meals over this break. Putting together 800 meals took an army of volunteers and at the center of it was community members and the Bement staff. We are also providing our students with learning opportunities and communicating with them during this time. We are also paying everyone their normal salary plus benefits, so that added stress is gone! We will get through this, we are strong, we are Bement!"

post_text: Two dozen Veterans took part of our Veterans Day Assembly here at school. The school's choir sang and the band played the Star-Spangled Banner, and selected students Zach Rogers and Quinn Flavin read essays honoring those who scarified so much. Pastor James Fielder spoke of his time in the Marine Corps, and Pastor Marsha Frederick read a selection while Taps was performed by Hailey Gadbury and Tori Vandivier. Pat Fay also developed a nice display of the service emblems, as well as the Gold Star Graduates of BHS, who gave the ultimate sacrifice to our country (these can be pictured below). Thank you to those who have and are serving our country in the armed forces. You are our heros! https://photos.app.goo.gl/cn5jibM2332rWp8n7
